definition: emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain

sentences.english: The idea of bringing revolution to the countryside had turned out to be a fantasy.
sentences.chinese: 改造农村的革命理想成了虚妄的幻想。

sentences.english: All evil thoughts are originally delusive, so you shall not be self-contemptuous.
sentences.chinese: 一切恶法，本是虚妄的，你不要太自卑你自己。

sentences.english: Therefore doth Job open his mouth in vain; he multiplieth words without knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 所以约伯开口说虚妄的话，多发无知识的言语。

sentences.english: Why do the nations conspire and the peoples plot in vain?
sentences.chinese: 外邦为什么争闹，万民为什么谋算虚妄的事。

sentences.english: Why do the heathen rage, and the people imagine a vain thing?
sentences.chinese: 外邦为什么争闹，万民为什么谋算虚妄的事。

sentences.english: 4He who has clean hands and a pure heart, who does not lift up his soul to an idol or swear by what is false.
sentences.chinese: 就是手洁心清，不向虚妄，起誓不怀诡诈的人。

sentences.english: China will not perish for foreign enemy, it is more likely to die in their own false.
sentences.chinese: 中国不会亡于外敌，倒有可能死在自己的虚妄。

sentences.english: All goodness is delusive , don't be too proud of yourself either.
sentences.chinese: 一切善法，也是虚妄的，你也不要太狂妄你自己。

sentences.english: He that hath clean hands, and a pure heart;
sentences.chinese: 就是手洁心清，不向虚妄，起誓不怀诡诈的人。

sentences.english: When I focus on living, all those other fake needs become less important.
sentences.chinese: 当我热爱生活时，那些无谓的虚妄会变得丝毫不重要。

sentences.english: All the evil law, this is false, you will not be too self-abased yourself.
sentences.chinese: 一切恶法，本是虚妄的，你不要太自卑你自己。

sentences.english: They lulled her into a false sense of security.
sentences.chinese: 他们哄骗她，使她产生一种虚妄的安全感。

sentences.english: All the good method, is also false, you also don't be too proud of your own.
sentences.chinese: 一切善法，也是虚妄的，你也不要太狂妄你自己。

sentences.english: Michael's teachings convinced Allen that the life he was living was phony.
sentences.chinese: 迈克尔的教诲让艾伦觉得自己的人生是如此的虚妄。

sentences.english: The Lord knows the thoughts of man; he knows that they are futile.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华知道人的意念是虚妄的。

sentences.english: From this, only then interference of letter interest group says legislatively to be not unfounded.
sentences.chinese: 由此，始信利益集团干扰立法之说并非虚妄。

definition: unreal/illusory/imaginary/vague and with nothing in it
actual situation/the ultimate essence of things (Buddhism)
(of dreams, hopes etc) to vanish/to evaporate/(of a person) to become disillusioned/disillusionment
to stand aloof/to be detached from/to transcend worldliness/untrammeled/unconventional
